AGENDA
Activity 1: “Juice Generator”: How do your youth know and navigate your community?
[See worksheet above]
	* How do youth in your community discover opportunities that align to their interests, link to their learning, and can help them “level up” towards a prospective livelihood? List as many (re)sources and strategies as you can.
		* Why do you feel youth DON’T take advantages of your community’s barriers? What are the barriers?
	* What are 10 resources in your city/community you think youth would enjoy but that they’re not currently engaging with? 
 
Debrief/ Discussion of Juice Generator Activity
Youth hear about opportunities from churches, peers, libraries, educators
College students learn about internships from college advisors (which advantages those who are able to go to college)
Internet is also useful but oftentimes the opportunities are not local or timing doesn't match
--> Online platforms that are interesting/promising: City of learning platform; LRNG platform; The Connectory

Activity 4: Synthesis and Next Steps
	* How do you envision drawing upon brokering and/or developing a digital road map for your youth?  What are 2-3 concrete next steps you can take in the coming month(s)?
		* This could be a great opportunity for youth from different organizations to network through maps.
		* In schools managing transitions and offering exciting opportunities
		* 
	* Any a-ha moments, about brokering or lack thereof in your context?
		* Young people need to be be centered in the design of this tool (less so organizations).
		* Site form should have contact info if possible to encourage collaboration and sharing.
		* The idea of providing transportation in a fun way (uber vs. the usual bus!)
		* Blogging as a form of documentation, reference and resource
		* We need this system to make our current work/partnerships become more visible.

	* What are some open questions you still have about brokering?
		* Factors that triggers brokering at community level—what are the motivating factors for youth?
		* Possible key partnerships with schools
		* How do we ensure we are building trusting relationships for brokering? (Esp if tech is the mode of communication)

	* What challenges do you anticipate you’ll have in implementing approaches like this within your context?
		* Making a compelling case for new sites in text form
		* Scaling up this to many organizations and centers
